  53 # Borrowed from Pew.
  54 # See https://github.com/berdario/pew/blob/master/pew/_utils.py#L82
  55 @contextmanager
  56 def temp_environ():
  57     # type: () -> Iterator[None]
  58     """Allow the ability to set os.environ temporarily"""
  59     environ = dict(os.environ)
  60     try:
  61         yield
  62     finally:
  63         os.environ.clear()
  64         os.environ.update(environ)
  65 
  66 
  67 @contextmanager
  68 def temp_path():
  69     # type: () -> Iterator[None]
  70     """A context manager which allows the ability to set sys.path temporarily
  71 
  72     >>> path_from_virtualenv = load_path("/path/to/venv/bin/python")
  73     >>> print(sys.path)
  74     [
  75         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/bin',
  76         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python37.zip',
  77         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7',
  78         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7/lib-dynload',
  79         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7/site-packages'
  80     ]
  81     >>> with temp_path():
  82             sys.path = path_from_virtualenv
  83             # Running in the context of the path above
  84             run(["pip", "install", "stuff"])
  85     >>> print(sys.path)
  86     [
  87         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/bin',
  88         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python37.zip',
  89         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7',
  90         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7/lib-dynload',
  91         '/home/user/.pyenv/versions/3.7.0/lib/python3.7/site-packages'
  92     ]
  93 
  94     """
  95     path = [p for p in sys.path]
  96     try:
  97         yield
  98     finally:
  99         sys.path = [p for p in path]
 100 
 101 
 102 @contextmanager
 103 def cd(path):
 104     # type: () -> Iterator[None]
 105     """Context manager to temporarily change working directories
 106 
 107     :param str path: The directory to move into
 108 
 109     >>> print(os.path.abspath(os.curdir))
 110     '/home/user/code/myrepo'
 111     >>> with cd("/home/user/code/otherdir/subdir"):
 112     ...     print("Changed directory: %s" % os.path.abspath(os.curdir))
 113     Changed directory: /home/user/code/otherdir/subdir
 114     >>> print(os.path.abspath(os.curdir))
 115     '/home/user/code/myrepo'
 116     """
 117     if not path:
 118         return
 119     prev_cwd = Path.cwd().as_posix()
 120     if isinstance(path, Path):
 121         path = path.as_posix()
 122     os.chdir(str(path))
 123     try:
 124         yield
 125     finally:
 126         os.chdir(prev_cwd)
 127 
 128 
 129 @contextmanager
 130 def dummy_spinner(spin_type, text, **kwargs):
 131     # type: (str, str, Any)
 132     class FakeClass(object):
 133         def __init__(self, text=""):
 134             self.text = text
 135 
 136         def fail(self, exitcode=1, text=None):
 137             if text:
 138                 print(text)
 139             raise SystemExit(exitcode, text)
 140 
 141         def ok(self, text):
 142             print(text)
 143             return 0
 144 
 145         def write(self, text):
 146             print(text)
 147 
 148     myobj = FakeClass(text)
 149     yield myobj
 150 
 151 
 152 @contextmanager
 153 def spinner(
 154     spinner_name=None,  # type: Optional[str]
 155     start_text=None,  # type: Optional[str]
 156     handler_map=None,  # type: Optional[Dict[str, Callable]]
 157     nospin=False,  # type: bool
 158     write_to_stdout=True,  # type: bool
 159 ):
 160     # type: (...) -> ContextManager[TSpinner]
 161     """Get a spinner object or a dummy spinner to wrap a context.
 162 
 163     :param str spinner_name: A spinner type e.g. "dots" or "bouncingBar" (default: {"bouncingBar"})
 164     :param str start_text: Text to start off the spinner with (default: {None})
 165     :param dict handler_map: Handler map for signals to be handled gracefully (default: {None})
 166     :param bool nospin: If true, use the dummy spinner (default: {False})
 167     :param bool write_to_stdout: Writes to stdout if true, otherwise writes to stderr (default: True)
 168     :return: A spinner object which can be manipulated while alive
 169     :rtype: :class:`~vistir.spin.VistirSpinner`
 170 
 171     Raises:
 172         RuntimeError -- Raised if the spinner extra is not installed
 173     """
 174 
 175     from .spin import create_spinner
 176 
 177     has_yaspin = None
 178     try:
 179         import yaspin
 180     except ImportError:
 181         has_yaspin = False
 182         if not nospin:
 183             raise RuntimeError(
 184                 "Failed to import spinner! Reinstall vistir with command:"
 185                 " pip install --upgrade vistir[spinner]"
 186             )
 187         else:
 188             spinner_name = ""
 189     else:
 190         has_yaspin = True
 191         spinner_name = ""
 192     use_yaspin = (has_yaspin is False) or (nospin is True)
 193     if has_yaspin is None or has_yaspin is True and not nospin:
 194         use_yaspin = True
 195     if start_text is None and use_yaspin is True:
 196         start_text = "Running..."
 197     with create_spinner(
 198         spinner_name=spinner_name,
 199         text=start_text,
 200         handler_map=handler_map,
 201         nospin=nospin,
 202         use_yaspin=use_yaspin,
 203         write_to_stdout=write_to_stdout,
 204     ) as _spinner:
 205         yield _spinner
 206 
 207 
 208 @contextmanager
 209 def atomic_open_for_write(target, binary=False, newline=None, encoding=None):
 210     # type: (str, bool, Optional[str], Optional[str]) -> None
 211     """Atomically open `target` for writing.
 212 
 213     This is based on Lektor's `atomic_open()` utility, but simplified a lot
 214     to handle only writing, and skip many multi-process/thread edge cases
 215     handled by Werkzeug.
 216 
 217     :param str target: Target filename to write
 218     :param bool binary: Whether to open in binary mode, default False
 219     :param Optional[str] newline: The newline character to use when writing, determined
 220         from system if not supplied.
 221     :param Optional[str] encoding: The encoding to use when writing, defaults to system
 222         encoding.
 223 
 224     How this works:
 225 
 226     * Create a temp file (in the same directory of the actual target), and
 227       yield for surrounding code to write to it.
 228     * If some thing goes wrong, try to remove the temp file. The actual target
 229       is not touched whatsoever.
 230     * If everything goes well, close the temp file, and replace the actual
 231       target with this new file.
 232 
 233     .. code:: python
 234 
 235         >>> fn = "test_file.txt"
 236         >>> def read_test_file(filename=fn):
 237                 with open(filename, 'r') as fh:
 238                     print(fh.read().strip())
 239 
 240         >>> with open(fn, "w") as fh:
 241                 fh.write("this is some test text")
 242         >>> read_test_file()
 243         this is some test text
 244 
 245         >>> def raise_exception_while_writing(filename):
 246                 with open(filename, "w") as fh:
 247                     fh.write("writing some new text")
 248                     raise RuntimeError("Uh oh, hope your file didn't get overwritten")
 249 
 250         >>> raise_exception_while_writing(fn)
 251         Traceback (most recent call last):
 252             ...
 253         RuntimeError: Uh oh, hope your file didn't get overwritten
 254         >>> read_test_file()
 255         writing some new text
 256 
 257         # Now try with vistir
 258         >>> def raise_exception_while_writing(filename):
 259                 with vistir.contextmanagers.atomic_open_for_write(filename) as fh:
 260                     fh.write("Overwriting all the text from before with even newer text")
 261                     raise RuntimeError("But did it get overwritten now?")
 262 
 263         >>> raise_exception_while_writing(fn)
 264             Traceback (most recent call last):
 265                 ...
 266             RuntimeError: But did it get overwritten now?
 267 
 268         >>> read_test_file()
 269             writing some new text
 270     """
 271 
 272     mode = "w+b" if binary else "w"
 273     f = NamedTemporaryFile(
 274         dir=os.path.dirname(target),
 275         prefix=".__atomic-write",
 276         mode=mode,
 277         encoding=encoding,
 278         newline=newline,
 279         delete=False,
 280     )
 281     # set permissions to 0644
 282     try:
 283         os.chmod(f.name, stat.S_IWUSR | stat.S_IRUSR | stat.S_IRGRP | stat.S_IROTH)
 284     except OSError:
 285         pass
 286     try:
 287         yield f
 288     except BaseException:
 289         f.close()
 290         try:
 291             os.remove(f.name)
 292         except OSError:
 293             pass
 294         raise
 295     else:
 296         f.close()
 297         try:
 298             os.remove(target)  # This is needed on Windows.
 299         except OSError:
 300             pass
 301         os.rename(f.name, target)  # No os.replace() on Python 2.
 302 
 303 
 304 @contextmanager
 305 def open_file(
 306     link,  # type: Union[_T, str]
 307     session=None,  # type: Optional[Session]
 308     stream=True,  # type: bool
 309 ):
 310     # type: (...) -> ContextManager[Union[IO[bytes], Urllib3_HTTPResponse, Urllib_HTTPResponse]]
 311     """
 312     Open local or remote file for reading.
 313 
 314     :param pip._internal.index.Link link: A link object from resolving dependencies with
 315         pip, or else a URL.
 316     :param Optional[Session] session: A :class:`~requests.Session` instance
 317     :param bool stream: Whether to stream the content if remote, default True
 318     :raises ValueError: If link points to a local directory.
 319     :return: a context manager to the opened file-like object
 320     """
 321     if not isinstance(link, six.string_types):
 322         try:
 323             link = link.url_without_fragment
 324         except AttributeError:
 325             raise ValueError("Cannot parse url from unkown type: {0!r}".format(link))
 326 
 327     if not is_valid_url(link) and os.path.exists(link):
 328         link = path_to_url(link)
 329 
 330     if is_file_url(link):
 331         # Local URL
 332         local_path = url_to_path(link)
 333         if os.path.isdir(local_path):
 334             raise ValueError("Cannot open directory for read: {}".format(link))
 335         else:
 336             with io.open(local_path, "rb") as local_file:
 337                 yield local_file
 338     else:
 339         # Remote URL
 340         headers = {"Accept-Encoding": "identity"}
 341         if not session:
 342             try:
 343                 from requests import Session  # noqa
 344             except ImportError:
 345                 session = None
 346             else:
 347                 session = Session()
 348         if session is None:
 349             with closing(six.moves.urllib.request.urlopen(link)) as f:
 350                 yield f
 351         else:
 352             with session.get(link, headers=headers, stream=stream) as resp:
 353                 try:
 354                     raw = getattr(resp, "raw", None)
 355                     result = raw if raw else resp
 356                     yield result
 357                 finally:
 358                     if raw:
 359                         conn = raw._connection
 360                         if conn is not None:
 361                             conn.close()
 362                     result.close()
 363 
 364 
 365 @contextmanager
 366 def replaced_stream(stream_name):
 367     # type: (str) -> Iterator[IO[Text]]
 368     """
 369     Context manager to temporarily swap out *stream_name* with a stream wrapper.
 370 
 371     :param str stream_name: The name of a sys stream to wrap
 372     :returns: A ``StreamWrapper`` replacement, temporarily
 373 
 374     >>> orig_stdout = sys.stdout
 375     >>> with replaced_stream("stdout") as stdout:
 376     ...     sys.stdout.write("hello")
 377     ...     assert stdout.getvalue() == "hello"
 378 
 379     >>> sys.stdout.write("hello")
 380     'hello'
 381     """
 382 
 383     orig_stream = getattr(sys, stream_name)
 384     new_stream = six.StringIO()
 385     try:
 386         setattr(sys, stream_name, new_stream)
 387         yield getattr(sys, stream_name)
 388     finally:
 389         setattr(sys, stream_name, orig_stream)
 390 
 391 
 392 @contextmanager
 393 def replaced_streams():
 394     # type: () -> Iterator[Tuple[IO[Text], IO[Text]]]
 395     """
 396     Context manager to replace both ``sys.stdout`` and ``sys.stderr`` using
 397     ``replaced_stream``
 398 
 399     returns: *(stdout, stderr)*
 400 
 401     >>> import sys
 402     >>> with vistir.contextmanagers.replaced_streams() as streams:
 403     >>>     stdout, stderr = streams
 404     >>>     sys.stderr.write("test")
 405     >>>     sys.stdout.write("hello")
 406     >>>     assert stdout.getvalue() == "hello"
 407     >>>     assert stderr.getvalue() == "test"
 408 
 409     >>> stdout.getvalue()
 410     'hello'
 411 
 412     >>> stderr.getvalue()
 413     'test'
 414     """
 415 
 416     with replaced_stream("stdout") as stdout:
 417         with replaced_stream("stderr") as stderr:
 418             yield (stdout, stderr)
